name: 林文印
objective: This course will investigate the theories of inertial, electrical, thermal and optical behavior of gas-borne particles. Topics about generation, collection, measurement and dynamics of aerosols will also be covered.
schedule:
1　　9-16-09　　Introduction and Definitions
2　　9-23-09　　Properties of Gases
3　　9-30-09　　Uniform Particle Motion
4　　10-7-09　　Particle Size Statistics
5　　10-14-09　　Curvilinear Particle Motion
6　　10-21-09　　Adhesion and Thermal Forces
7　　10-28-09　　Brownian Motion and Diffusion
8　　11-4-09　　Filtration
9　　11-11-09　　Midterm Exam
10　　11-18-09　　Coagulation
11　　11-25-09　　Condensation and Evaporation
12　　12-2-09　　Electrical Properties
13　　12-9-09　　Optical Properties
14　　12-16-09　　Sampling and Measurement
15　　12-23-09　　Atmospheric Aerosols
16　　12-30-09　　Nanoparticles
17　　1-6-10　　Term Project Presentations
18　　1-13-10　　Final Exam
scorePolicy:
1.　　Homework　　         30%
2.　　Midterm Exam　　20%
3.　　Final Exam　　20%
4.　　Term Project  　　30%
materials:
1. Aerosol Technology: Properties, Behavior, and Measurement of Airborne Particles, 2nd Ed, by William. C. Hinds, John Wiley & Sons
2. Atmospheric Chemistry & Physics of Air Pollution by J. H. Seinfeld, John Wiley & Sons
3. Fundamentals of Air Pollution Engineering, by R. C. Flagan & J. H. Seinfeld, Prentice Hall
4. Smoke, Dust and Haze, by S. Friedlander, John Wiley & Sons
5. Aerosol Measurement: Principles, Techniques and Applications, Edited by K. Willeke & P. Baron, John Wiley & Sons
